Her idea of making her trail hard to follow was changing cabs a couple of times. Cripes, where do they get their agents these days? Did I just dream the whole thing? Have I suffered some kind of episode? That leather duster jacket I wore…taking the rifle out from underneath the coast, putting it together…that awful pause before that woman fell to the floor after I squeezed the trigger… This six page PDF is an easy-to-integrate PC class and just the sort of thing needed for GMs to add depth to any great d20 Modern campaign world and gaming session.

140645.name: Prototype: Jury-Rigger
140645.description:
From publisher blurb:

Think fast, act faster. Jury rig a collection of household cleansers, some garbage bags and some superglue found under the kitchen sink into a hot air balloon and escape from the burning skyscraper just seconds before it collapses. Hotwire a semi just in time to ride to the rescue. Mix a woman’s perfume, some shoe polish and the soda you’re drinking into an improvised smoke bomb, and light the whole mess with your trusty Zippo. Escape from a locked jail cell in a supermax prison using only a piece of metal stolen from the kitchen and a few ‘borrowed’ pieces of string. This five page PDF is an easy-to-integrate PC class and just the sort of thing needed for GMs to add depth to any great d20 Modern campaign world and gaming session.

140646.name: Divekick
videogamehonor: 2013 Operation Rainfall Awards Best Mutliplayer Experience of the Year Nominee
2013 Spike (VGX) Best Fighting Game of the Year Nominee
2014 D.I.C.E. Fighting Game of the Year Nominee
140646.description:
User Summary

Divekick is a fighting game with only two controls: Dive and Kick. Successful Divekicks result in one million hit points of damage against opponents with one thousand HP.
The game is set to release in the summer on Windows, Playstation 3 and Vita.

140647.name: Prototype: Scalphunter
140647.description:
From publisher blurb:

Assassins today must deal with ever increasing security measures. Technology like X-ray screening units and metal detector make it nearly impossible to get a weapon near a heavily guarded target. A new breed of hired killer has developed a new method to bypass security. Known as scalphunters, these assassins can summon weapons into their hands from a mysterious dimensional pocket. No one knows how they are able to summon these weapons or where the weapons come from but no one has been able to detect a scalphunter before they summon a weapon. This 6 page PDF is just the sort of thing needed for GMs to add depth to any great d20 Modern campaign world, including Haven: City of Violence and Haven: Full Metal Zero.

140648.name: Prototype: Super Soldier
140648.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Super Soldier is a patriot who is willing to give everything his has for his nation and its people. This character has risked his life by volunteering for a dangerous military experiment, an experiment designed to create the perfect warrior. He is not just a better fighter, he has become something that is slightly more than human. The Super Soldier's physical abilities have been pushed beyond the limits of what ordinary men can achieve. He is tougher and more resilient than any other soldier could ever be. Not only is he physically superior and dangerous in combat, but the Super Soldier also possesses a driving spirit and indomitable will. It is his incomparable courage and willingness to sacrifice that enables the Super Soldier to inspire awe and confidence in those who fight beside him. This 6 PDF is just the sort of thing needed for GMs to add depth to any great d20 Modern campaign world, including Haven: City of Violence and Haven: Full Metal Zero. Nobody does the d20 Modern espionage and spies better!!!

140649.name: Prototype: Weapon Alpha
140649.description:
From publisher blurb:

The military spends billions for weapons research each year, improving everything from the simple infantry rifle to the most sophisticated missiles deployed on the battlefield. Publicly, only one component remains untouched, the actual soldier himself. Of course, the military does try to create superhuman soldiers, but only in secret, off the books programs. These programs have no consideration for the well being of the research subjects, but the few who survive the tests can develop incredible abilities at the price of their health or sanity. Few of these experimental subjects leave the military on good terms, either going A.W.O.L. or washing out for disciplinary reasons. These survivors wander the globe, haunted by the pain they've suffered in the name of science and power. This 6 page PDF is just the sort of thing needed for GMs to add depth to any great d20 Modern campaign world, including Haven: City of Violence and Haven: Full Metal Zero. Fans of Marvel Comics' Wolverine, X-23, Deadpool or Sabretooth will love to use this character.

140650.description:
The game Silhouette consists of 48 tiles with silhouette images on one side. These are placed on the table face down. The active player flips over two tiles and tries to make a compound word out of the two images. If successful, the player keeps the pair and goes again; if not, the tiles are returned and the next player now goes.

Once all tiles have been claimed (or no other pairings are possible), the player with most tiles wins.
140650.name: Silhouette

140651.name: Legend of Grimrock 2
140651.description:
User Summary
Legend of Grimrock 2 is an upcoming dungeon crawl RPG that is the sequel to Legend of Grimrock.

140652.name: Prototype: Chameleon
140652.description:
From publisher blurb:

The information age has made infiltration even more dangerous for the would-be spy. Data mining can uncover even the most studious falsified background of a spy and plastic surgery is no match for digital imaging technology. Security trumps espionage, or so it seems. A new breed of undercover agent can penetrate even the most paranoid organization, able to uncover the most highly guarded secrets. A literal chameleon, these agents can shape shift into a new form, changing their appearance, size, skin color, hair or even gender. These abilities are powered either by mutation or advanced genetic engineering experiments and honed by training and experience. Virtually all Chameleons are freelance spies, working for anyone who can find them and afford their talents. This 7 page PDF is just the sort of thing needed for GMs to add depth to any great d20 Modern campaign world, including Haven: City of Violence and Haven: Full Metal Zero.

140653.name: Prototype: Data Savant
140653.description:
From publisher blurb:

If the 21st century is indeed the Information Age, the Data Savant is an individual perfectly adapted to suit the era. Indeed, some neurobiologists and cognitive psychologists believe the abilities demonstrated by the Data Savant is evidence that the human brain is capable of evolving far more rapidly than ever thought possible to deal with an environment overloaded with information-rich stimuli. Others argue that there have always been those rare human beings possessed of extraordinary mental gifts, able to mentally manipulate data as easily as children rearrange toy blocks. These researchers argue that it is only in recent decades that those who display such genius have been properly categorized and recorded. Whichever hypothesis is correct, the Data Savant displays some truly amazing abilities, making his service much in demand. This six page PDF is an easy-to-integrate PC class and just the sort of thing needed for GMs to add depth to any great d20 Modern campaign world and gaming session.

140654.name: Corporate Insider
140654.description:
From publisher blurb:

There are many kinds of war, and sometimes the quiet orderly wars are the most world-shaking. Super soldiers with the right feat choices and gear have always been able to take on whole battalions; modern mages can reshape reality with their spells and force of will. Charismatic heroes and media personalities could be warriors too, using words, art and force of personality to win battles, con marks and live the good life. Until now though, social combat and interaction lagged behind run and gun action. The D20 Modern engine was designed to emulate action movies: its inspirations were equal Buffy the Vampire slayer and Rainbow Six. The new feats and classes presented here change all that. This supplement has all new materials including:

2 New Advanced Classes: The Advocate & Corporate Raider.
Over 30 new feats including Diplomatic Immunity, Insinuation and Retained Council




This 17 page PDF is just the sort of thing needed for GMs to add depth to any great d20 Modern campaign world, including Haven: City of Violence and Sanctuary: City of Secrets.

140655.name: Prototype: Pimp Daddy
140655.description:
From publisher blurb:

Being a Pimp Daddy is all about being seen, being cooler than cool, being the stylish cat rolling through town in a limo with a jacuzzi in the back, your two best hos in the tub with you, and twenty more hos out there walking the streets for you. You want to call yourself a Pimp Daddy, you better live up to the job. You better show up in gold and furs, sporting a diamond grill, Ingram Mac 10 one hand and a tall glass of Crunk Juice in the other. You’re going to need a girl for each arm, a good pair of fists and an even better line on your lips at all time, and enough green to buy a small island. The new feats created in this sourcebook are intended to be compatible with the standard rules for D20 Modern, and you can easily integrate them in to your local game. In this Sourcebook there are:

Blackmail: Nobody wants you angry, because they’re afraid of what you know, and what you’ll say.
Dress to Impress: You wear only big name designers and multi-thousand dollar jewels, and always look your best.
Local Hero: You are a local celebrity, extremely well known in a specific city or neighborhood.
Sexual Healin’: Marvin Gaye said it best. Sometimes you just need a little bit of sexual medicine.
Street Dealer: Your product is widely regarded as the best shit on the street; your reputation as a drug chemist is unquestioned.




This 6 page PDF is just the sort of thing needed for GMs to add depth to any great d20 Modern campaign world, including Haven: City of Violence and Sanctuary: City of Secrets.

140656.name: Prototype: Original Gangsta'
140656.description:
From publisher blurb:

You've been with the gang since you were a kid, and even before you joined back when you were just a little vato, you dreamed of wearing the colors. You joined the gang with the same fervor that patriots join the military, ready to live and die to defend your few blocks of turf, your small time drug empire and your homies. Prison hardened you, and as you took on mission after bloody mission for the gang, your status and reputation only increased. Now, you're on the verge of being an OG, a shot caller, one of the old school bangers that give orders to the up and comers and live a life of hard won respect. You're still tough enough, crazy enough for the street, and still ready to grab your iron at the first sign of disrespect or danger. This 5 page PDF is just the sort of thing needed for GMs to add depth to any great d20 Modern campaign world, including Haven: City of Violence and Sanctuary: City of Secrets.

140657.name: Prototype: Blue Equalizer
140657.description:
From publisher blurb:

You joined the force with the best of intentions; you wanted to lock up the bad guys and protect the innocents, but somewhere along the way things got twisted. Somewhere along the way, you realized that the laws you are supposed to enforce are meaningless; the crooks have the firepower, the money and the sheer insanity to ignore the law. Somewhere along the way, you realized the only good cops were retired, dead or on the take, and you were rolling down the streets with the dregs. Somewhere along the way, you realized that it's easier to just kick in the door on some pretext than bother getting a warrant, and that is easier to beat a thief senseless or put a bullet in a rapist's head than trust the courts to sentence them. This 5 PDF is just the sort of thing needed for GMs to add depth to any great d20 Modern campaign world, including Haven: City of Violence and Sanctuary: City of Secrets.

140658.name: Prototype: Seductress
140658.description:
From publisher blurb:

The dank dungeon cell as getting boring, as well as disgusting, and since rescue didn’t seem to be coming, Mopsy Segalle decided to liberate herself. A few minutes of effort and straining muscles, and she was free of the straight jacket, and just in time too; she was sure the coarse sackcloth was going to give her just the worst rash. A few more moments of work with one of her hair pins, and the steel chains binding her ankles fell away. Now to get out of this cell! Pressing herself against the bars, Mopsy just had to wait a few more minutes for one of the brainwashed cultists to pass by on one of his regular patrols. The masked cultist’s dark brown robes couldn’t conceal his shock at seeing the beautiful girl standing there, free, and the befuddled thug was even more confused when she gestured seductively towards him. This 4 page PDF is an easy-to-integrate PC class and just the sort of thing needed for GMs to add depth to any great d20 Modern Neo-Pulp setting and campaign world including Haven: City of Bronze.

140659.name: Prototype: Galactic Space Ace
140659.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Galactic Space Ace is a Pulp Era hero whose adventures carry her beyond the farthest frontiers of the little blue orb that mankind calls home. The Galactic Space Ace serves as humanity's ambassador to the alien civilizations that dwell amongst the stars. She is an explorer-scientist, representing the best Earth has to offer, proving her worth to more technologically advanced races through her courage, daring, and intelligence. She backs up her confidence with a keen mind and formidable fighting skills, allowing her to overcome the bizarre extraterrestrial creatures and otherworldly environments that she must face on a routine basis. While the Galactic Space Ace is often initially dismissed as a mere savage by the super-scientific extraterrestrials she encounters, her deeds soon prove her worth. In time the Galactic Space Ace creates a legend all her own, a member of technologically primitive race who nonetheless triumphs over every star-born menace.

This supplement has includes:

New Feats: Jet Pack Operation and Advanced Jet Pack Operation
New Space-Faring Gear: Jetpack, Raygun, Space Suit & Spacecraft




This 7 page PDF is just the sort of thing needed for GMs to add depth to any great d20 Modern campaign world, including Haven: City of Bronze and Victory: War of Bronze. Fans of the movie the science-fiction serial Commando Cody and Buck Rogers will love to have this class.

140660.name: Prototype: Master of the Underworld
140660.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Master of the Underworld is the nemesis of the pulp heroes, the antithesis of all this is decent, good, and just. No mere mob chieftain, the Master of the Underworld is a criminal genius, a master plotter whose abilities, resources, and skills make him the equal of the era's various mystery men, the champions of law that ordinary criminals fear. Just like those worthies, the Master of the Underworld's real identity is hidden from the world, unknown even to his closest cohorts. His masked visage serves both to protect his precious secrets and to frighten those foolish enough to take sides against him. And just as the mystery men employ unusual, even extraordinary equipment and tactics, so does the Master of the Underworld have his own fantastic accoutrements-weapons created by weird science, horrible devices for which the pulp world is not yet ready. This 8 page PDF is just the sort of thing needed for GMs to add depth to any great d20 Pulp campaign world, including Haven: City of Bronze.

140661.name: Prototype: Mata Hari
140661.description:
From publisher blurb:
The Mata Hari class is named after the infamous actress, courtesan, and secret operative who operated during World War I. The historical Mata Hari was a Frenchwoman who used her sex appeal to gain access to numerous diplomats, generals, and politicians across several nations, only to reveal their secrets to her German paymasters. The d20 Pulp Mata Hari is the evil counterpart to the Seductress class, an accomplished, amoral female spy, saboteur, and (when necessary) assassin who serves as beautiful but deadly nemesis for both male and female pulp heroes. Her most lethal assets are her charm, class, and beauty-closely followed by her expertise with knives and poisons. This 6 page PDF is an easy-to-integrate PC class and just the sort of thing needed for GMs to add depth to any great d20 Modern Neo-Pulp setting and campaign world including Haven: City of Bronze.

140663.description:
Tensions mount in the war for the crown, and both sides are turning to new tactics and strange allies. Battlefields are haunted by ghosts, buffeted by invisible forces and wracked by lightning. Armies march under the auspice of statues, and secure formations are breached by attacks from odd directions. Which side will best master these new devices and capture the enemy sovereign?

For our popular deck-building game, For the Crown 2nd edition, comes the first expansion, Shock & Awe, introducing 13 new cards and 10 new unit types to pit against your opponent. Bolster your economy with the Caravan, duplicate key assets with the Changeling, and rule the battlefield with the mighty Amazon. Who has the wit and will to lead these new forces to victory, and who will succumb to Shock and Awe?

Note, the For the Crown Expansion Kit 1: Shock & Awe is not a ‘stand alone’ game. You must own a copy of For the Crown 2nd edition to use this expansion kit. This expansion kit cannot be used with the first edition of For the Crown.

Game Data:

Complexity: 3 on a 9 scale
Solitaire Suitability: 2 on a 9 scale

Polybag Game Components:

• One two-sided Rules sheet
• 55 thick, two-sided, laser-cut game units
• 50 deck-building cards

What's In The Box?:

• One two-sided Rules sheet
• 55 thick, two-sided, laser-cut game units
• 50 deck-building cards
• One bright red, 9 1/4" x 5 7/8" Standard cardboard VPG game box
• One beautiful box cover sleeve
• One "Wipes-A-Lot" napkin
• One charcoal dessicant packet
140663.name: For the Crown Expansion #1: Shock & Awe

140664.description:
From a user review of the Sportsman edition:

Players divide themselves into teams. Teams alternate turns choosing stunts and trying to complete them within the sixty-second time limit. Each completed stunt earns the player/team one point. The first entity to reach the predetermined goal, the rules suggest eleven, wins.

The Sportsman game comes with instructions for fifteen stunts and props. The Mattel Board Game version comes with equipment/instructions for 40 stunts.
140664.name: Minute to Win It

140665.name: Only Fools and Horses Trotters Trading Game
140665.description:
This game is based on the BBC TV comedy series "Only Fools and Horses".

The goal of the game is to become a millionaire buy doing some dodgy deals around Peckam and then going to the Casino to win your fortune. You need a minimum bid of a "monkey" (500 quid). Be the first to win a "million".

boardgamecompilation: Darkest Night Promo Pack: From Distant Lands
140666.description:
The Nymph was available for purchase through the Geek Store (now out of stock).

From the product page:

"The wilderness surrounding the kingdom is rumored to contain many mysterious and wondrous things, but rare is the day when one of them makes its presence known. The Nymph has strange and potent abilities linked to the cycles of nature, and motives that few men might guess, but any ally against the Necromancer is welcome in the kingdom today."

This is a special, promotional package that is being offered exclusively to BoardGameGeek for six months (as of April 15th, 2013). This package includes the Nymph along with 10 power cards, plus a new event and an artifact. This is a must-have for all Darkest Night fans!

This game requires Darkest Night (First edition)

Game Components:

• 10 Power cards
• 1 Artifact card
• 1 Event card
• 1 Hero card
• 1 character tracker (minor assembly reqired)
140666.name: Darkest Night: Nymph Promo

140667.name: Cross Factors Cross Multiply
140667.description:
Two games in one!

The object of Cross Factors is to be the first to cover two sets of numbers (from 1 to 12) by moving around on the board. For example, if a player landed on the number 24 then he could cover a 6 and a 4, or a 2 and a 12.

In Cross Multiply you try to gain the most points by creating rows of three or more on a multiplication table. This is done by first creating two numbers by rolling two dice (twice) and adding them together. These numbers are then used as the X and Y indices (or vice versa) on the table to claim a square in the table. On each subsequent turn the player can choose to replace one of the two numbers and thereby capture a new position on the table.

140668.name: Field of Glory - Decline and Fall
140668.description:
The Field of Glory now moves to the Middle East with Field of Glory – Decline and Fall! Based on the armies of the Byzantine Empire, the Islamic states and their other enemies, from 493 AD until the mid 11th century, Decline and Fall is the seventh army pack in this award winning ancient strategy series. Decline and Fall boasts 200 new battle group graphics and supporting info for the D.A.G. lists, over twelve new historical battles, and more!

Source: The Publisher Website.

140669.name: Payday 2
videogamehonor: 2013 Global Game Awards Best Co-op Game of the Year Winner
2013 Golden Joystick Multiplayer Game of the Year Winner
2013 Operation Rainfall Awards Best Mutliplayer Experience of the Year Nominee
140669.description:
User Summary

Payday 2 introduces new game elements into the series:

- Heists that take multiple days
- Random "Escape" encounters
- Pro Jobs (higher reward, can't be retried if failed)
- Modifiable weapons
- Modifiable masks
- Skill Points which can be distributed onto one of five skill trees
- ECM Jammers to disable electronic devices such as cell phones and keypad locks
- More Stealth options
- Casing mode
- Spendable money (used for weapons, skills, masks, weapon/mask modifications)
- Multiple armor types
- A metal-cutting Saw

Most heists can be done using only stealth. Successfully doing so will also make the following days of a multiple day heist easier. The focus of the game for the most part is still about stealing stuff.

Though there are still standard "bank heist" style missions (with variations based on what your intel says is in the vault), some newer missions involve causing general mayhem, such as terrorizing stores in order to force the owners to pay a Russian mobster for "protection". Others involve assisting a corrupt politician in taking down his rivals, or getting revenge on a drug cartel's enemies.

The difficulty of the game has been adjusted compared to the first Payday: The Heist. There are five classes from which players can choose their skills. Teamwork is encouraged by offering those skills with better perks if players stay within one class. Even new players can beat heists on Deathwish (hardest difficulty) with the right strategy.

Some heists can be finished in less than 50 seconds (Ukrainian Job on Overkill) or even 20 seconds (Jewelry Store on Normal).

140670.name: Pactio
140670.description:
In Pactio all players build the same city. However as all of the players get different roles, they might have different agendas, and ideas for the city.

The game center point is buying buildings and developing them, as they often synergise with themselves, or your role. They also serve as your source of income to fuel your actions for the future. In addition players influence public figures and/or make deals with each other to further aid your goal.

The goal of the game is to get the most victory points by the end of 16-th turn, that is when the game ends. You gain them, again, from buildings, but also from role's missions, which might be related to buildings, but might be completely unique things. For example Pishop gets 5 Victory points if all other players' final scores are not too far apart (difference can't be bigger than 6).

Unique aspects of the game include that all deals are binding, meaning they are enforced by the game rules. Also the implementation of roles in an economical environment leads to loads of new and very interesting gameplay.

140673.description:
Description from the publisher:

Dr. Seuss: 3 Terrific Card Games! includes Crazy 8s, Go Fish, and a one-of-a-kind ABC Memory game with The Cat in the Hat, Horton, Yertle the Turtle, and many more favorite Dr. Seuss characters!
140673.name: Dr. Seuss: 3 Terrific Card Games!

140674.description:
Legacy: The Card Game is a fantasy based card battle game played by two opposing players in a turn-by-turn style.

Both players start with 1200 life points.

Each player builds their own deck or uses a Pre-Constructed deck from the Legacy Core Set, and tries to get the opponents life points to Zero through the use of Characters, Spells and Ttems.

Legacy TCG is VAST and has an expansive universe! There are many Heroes with Amazing powers at your disposal. The type of decks you build are entirely up to you... Will you use a Hero? or Multiple heroes? or maybe try to over run your enemy with only monsters? Perhaps Playing only Gadgets and Gizmos to trap your opponent using technology? Perhaps restricting your opponents movements through the use of Control cards? There are near endless combinations at your fingertips!
140674.name: Legacy: The Card Game – Core Set
boardgamepodcastepisode: House Rules 60: Constructed Decks? Why Not Legacy TCG?

140675.name: Enchanted Cupcake Party Game
140675.description:
In Enchanted Cupcake Party Game, you want to make as many cupcakes as possible before time runs out. The more cupcakes you make, the bigger the party you can hold in celebration of your awesome cupcake-making skills!

To set up the game, shuffle the mix, bake, decorate and clock tiles face down, and place the cupcake parts and recipe cards to the side. Take turns flipping over one tile at a time. If you ever have a mix, bake and decorate tile revealed, then start the sand timer, draw a recipe card, and quickly try to fund and assemble the proper cupcake parts. If you finish before time runs out, draw a new recipe card and keep going. Once the sand timer runs out, flip all the tiles face down and start again.

If you ever reveal all four clock tiles, then time has run out and the game is over. Your collective score is equal to the number of cupcakes you've created. Will you be suffering from a cupcake crisis, or will you be ready to host a perfect princess party?

140676.description:
Geodeto Geodeto is an EASY-FAST-FUN card game with pyramids for 2-6 players (age 8+) that takes the best from Pyramideto game and increases the gaming experience for older players.

There are six Continent cards in six colors in the game representing Europe, Asia, America, Oceania, Antarctica and Africa.
Every continent is connected to two neighboring continents and to the World Ocean in the middle of the board.

Players set for how many fulfilled goals they want to play to control the length of the game. (Publisher recommands 10-15 goals per game.)

Once the last game is fulfilled, players count their points. The one with the most points wins the game.

Motto: Travelers, globetrotters, set the sails and sail the seven seas. Can you circumnavigate the world in 20 minutes?

You need one set of iGo pyramids (= 18 pyramids) and a deck of Geodeto cards to play Geodeto.
140676.name: Geodeto

140677.name: Cinderella Royal Ball Game
140677.description:
In Cinderella Royal Ball Game, the players are trying to collect as many figures from the dance floor as they can, but you never know where the music might take them...

To set up the game, place the character figures in their bases and the bases on the dance floor. Players then take turns drawing a card from the deck:


If you draw a character card, place it in front of you.
If you draw a pass card, pass one character card that doesn't have a figure on it to the player on your left.
If you draw a dance card, press the button on the dance floor and watch the figures waltz around. When the dancing stops, you claim any figures in your sector of the dance floor if you have a character card matching those figures.


When all the figures have been claimed or the deck runs out, the game ends. Players score the points listed on the character cards they hold – but only if they hold this figure! The player with the highest score wins.

140679.description:
"Life is a maze—an infinite maze—that shifts with the will of its inhabitants. You are an explorer of this labyrinthine realm, trying on roles and pioneering foreign terrain, aiding friends and outsmarting rivals. To shape the world and find your place in it means drawing on powers you never knew you had in the hopes of one day reaching your goal, the one prize that can't be found around any of the labyrinth's dizzying twists and bends: the real you."


An Awesome Game


Labyrinth Life is a tabletop strategy card game for 2-6 players, ages 12 and up. It's fast to learn, and fun to master.

In Labyrinth Life, you play an explorer who braves an ever-changing maze in search of your future self. Will you be the first to reach bliss as perhaps the Richest Woman in New Mazonia or perhaps the Hallball Team Captain? It's all up to you!

Over the course of the game, players build a maze of hexagonal cards and they move their maze explorers through it.

Every round, you move more maze explorer forward 5 spaces, draw a card, and play a card. You play a card by placing it in the maze and using one of the two powers listed on it.

The sixteen powers allow you to affect the maze and the explorers within it. It's possible to chain multiple powers and plan elaborate strategies over multiple turns.

Strategies center around moving your explorer into cards related to your goal card, and keeping other players from moving their explorers into cards related to theirs. You gain two points for moving your explorer into cards that share a power with your goal card and you lose one point for every card you move into that isn't related. Goals can change.

You win the game by reaching the target point total.


A Work of Art


Each deck of Labyrinth Life is different. The cast of characters, constellations of maze paths, and the solitaire maze that spans the back of your 120-card deck are absolutely unique, and offer an entirely different play experience from every other deck out there.


The Ultimate Collaboration


Early supporters of Labyrinth Life suggest and vote on the characters that will populate the maze. Each deck is a unique culture built from the the pool the fans create.
140679.name: Labyrinth Life: The Maze of Being You

140680.description:
La Bataille de Leipzig 1813 - La Bataille de Dölitz 1813

The Battle of Leipzig, fought in 1813, is one of the largest conflicts ever and involved many countries / kingdoms fighting against each other. This included a coalition of Russia, Prussia and Austria committed to defeat France and its allies, forging a domination of Europe that would lead to the Nationalism of Germany. While historians have drawn a myriad of contrary opinions about who were the good guys and bad guys, the battle encircles the city of Leipzig with 500,000 man armies facing each other.

La Bataille de Dölitz 1813 occured on October 16h, when forces under Général de Division Kaminieki (Polish) and General Lefol (French) defended the line along the Pleisse River. The river was murky and swollen from previous weeks of rainfall. Men and horses could cross the river only in a few places. These crossings were at Connewitz and Dölitz. Part of the 26e Polish division defended the intact bridge at Dölitz with its manor house guarding the entrance.

This is the area that Schwarzenberg choose to lead an assault to outflank Napoleon’s army. Therefore Schwarzenberg committed substantial Austrian troops to this assault.While outnumbering the French and Polish forces, General der Kavallerie Graf Merveldt’s 2nd Army Abteilung found forcing either crossing a major problem. Unable to deploy his artillery because of the swampy ground, his infantry fought a battle of attrition with an enemy in built-up areas or on the other side of a major river.

Merveldt has been assigned one thing however that may assist him in getting across. He has the two army pontoon and two pioneer companies. They can be used to throw a bridge across the Pleisse or repair the bridge at Connewitz. The player will note immediately the differences in the different formations and how each must be managed to achieve success.

Each 20 minute turn starts with a Command Phase for both sides followed by the French Player sequence and then by the Coalitian Player sequence. The sequence includes movement, cavalry charges, fire and melee. During each, morale plays a decisive role. This is a great one player on one player game but will also accommodate two players on a side also.

The original rules have been updated, but not expanded to any extent. The original designers of the La Bataille Series believe the Premier Rules facilitate / expedite the most accurate and competitive play. The new Premier Rules are an update of the original rules but make it easier to find specific topics and includes some user requested rules such as command control.

This game was initially offered as print and play by Marshal Enterprises; it is now removed and available as part of the commercial La Bataille de Leipzig.

The scale is standard "La Bat":

100 meters per hex.
100 men per infantry strength point/ 50 men per cavalry strength point/ 2 to 4 guns per strength point for artillery.
140680.name: La Bataille de Dölitz 1813

140681.description:
This card was given out at International Tabletop Day.

Its text reads:

"Hit 1 Monster in any color Archer, Knight, or Swordsman ring."
140681.name: Castle Panic: Any Color Hero Promo

140682.name: Czas Honoru: Operacja Most III
140682.description:
German occupied Poland, 1944. Beyond the reach of Allied intelligence and bomber commands, the Germans establish a secret facility, where a terrifying weapon is being tested. V-2, Hitler's Wunderwaffe, a ballistic missile able to wipe London from the map and win the war, bringing Britain to her knees. But the deepest secrets of German war technology are revealed by the UK's staunchest allies - the Poles...

Czas Honoru: Operacja Most III – a.k.a. Days of Honor: Operation Wildhorn III – is a fast-paced, tactical card wargame for two players. The first player takes the role of the Polish commander. His goal is to collect fragments from rockets test-fired from the German missile base. The second player takes the role of the German commander and is trying to protect the secrets of the rocket testing area.

The game lasts four turns. Each turn begins with a missile test, which scatters new fragments of the rocket in the peripheral area surrounding the testing ground. Players alternately take turns during which they place their units on the table and perform actions. Players use scouts to collect missile fragments, but they need to be protected by soldiers and partisans because enemy contact can lead to combat. These actions are supported by elite units: Polish Unseen and Silent commandos and German SS Stormtroopers, who are able to penetrate enemy lines. In addition, players build a network of command and support units, which allows them to effectively carry out their actions.

Players also affect the course of the game during their opponent's moves, playing cards for immediate effects. And each side has a set of unique events, e.g., Germans can use their logistical advantages while Poles can hide, and even evacuate rocket fragments to England! To determine combat and exploration results, players each use a six-sided die, but they have many opportunities to modify the results, so a good plan should work even with bad luck.

At the end of the game, the player with more rocket parts wins. This means the player successfully stole (Polish) or concealed (German) the secrets of the V-2 weapon.

140683.name: Lickety Quick
140683.description:
Word-building card game. One set of cards features beginning letters or letter combinations; the other features Lickety Quick clues—part of speech, double letters, number of syllables, and more. Combine the two to make a word first and you win the round and gets the cards as a points.

Player who has collected the most points (cards) at the end of the game is the winner

140684.name: Connect with Pieces: Pacific Rim
boardgamepodcastepisode: The One About Crossovers
140684.description:
The game components are the (700) pieces of a jigsaw puzzle. Each piece has one of five symbols embossed on it. Solid-color pieces may be able to fit in more than one position in the puzzle, but other pieces will only have one valid position.

The players are all working to assemble the puzzle; using the main set of rules, one player plays for a minute at a time, with the others using this time to select pieces from the box. There are also "scramble" rules in which all players can select pieces and play them as they wish.

Regardless of the rules used, players score points for playing pieces, with more points being awarded for playing more pieces and for playing rows of three pieces with the same symbol or squares of pieces with four different symbols. Points are also awarded for correcting misplaced pieces.

Players can play for a given amount of time or until someone reaches a given score (or until the puzzle is finished).

140685.name: Go Diego Go! Rescue the Animals
140685.description:
Simple card and logic game for kids (4+). Each player receives 6 blue cards at the beginning of the game, placed face-up in front of him. There are 4 animals on each blue card. Every turn, a player draws an orange card from a common deck. There are two animals on each orange card, with or without a big red "X" on them. All players then try to discard blue cards based on the conditions of the orange card.

If the two animals on the orange card are not marked with an X, a player can discard all blue cards featuring both animals. If the two animals on the orange card are marked with an X, a player can discard all blue cards not featuring both animals. If only one of the animals is marked with an X, discarded cards must feature the unmarked animal and exclude the marked animal. If you cannot discard, you must draw another blue card. There are 6 special orange cards that allow only the drawing player to discard.

The first player to get rid of all his blue cards wins, he has saved the animals!

140686.name: iPuppet Presents: Colin's Classic Cards
videogamecompilation: Extreme Fun 5 Top Selling Mac Games
140686.description:
User Summary:

Includes Hearts, Spades, Euchre and Pitch.

140687.name: Extreme Fun 5 Top Selling Mac Games
videogamecompilation: Star Wars: Galactic Battlegrounds – Clone Campaigns
140687.description:
User Summary

A compilation of games released for the Mac in 2003

140688.name: Caeron 3000: Addendum & Errata
140688.description:
From the PDF:

"This supplment is primarily a resource for people who own the
original print version of the Caeron 3000 Basic Rulebook. It
contains important corrections to that text, improved species
artwork, and other artwork that did not make the release deadline.

For owners of the PDF versions, these corrections and additional
artwork will be added and released as a free upgrade to the existing
document."

140690.name: Nimble Quest
140690.description:
Nimble Quest is an adventure video game released by NimbleBit on March 28th, 2013.

In Nimble Quest, the gameplay is similar to snake in a few ways. The player moves around and kills enemies whom he gets close enough in proximity to. Once enough enemies are killed, you advance to the next level. If you hit a wall, an enemy, or you run out of health, you die.

Source: Wikipedia, "Nimble quest", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

140692.description:
Battleground: Fantasy Warfare Terrain Pack is a new support product to enhance that already great game play with art by David Lloyd! This terrain pack is printed on laminated cardstock to give you terrain that combines beauty and durability. You can write on the terrain with wet or dry-erase marker and then wipe clean at end of play. Although designed for use with Battleground: Fantasy Warfare, this pack can be used with most tabletop wargames or to set the scene in RPGs.
From the publisher's website.
140692.name: Battleground: Fantasy Warfare Terrain Pack

140693.description:
The party game Werewolf has been popular for many years, but now it's time to put the cat amongst the pigeons – or the fox amongst the chickens, anyway. In this new take on the classic format, Fox & Chicken sees players fighting for survival, striving for either a Vulpine Victory or Cheering Chickens. As the nights pass, more and more chickens will disappear from the henhouse. Thankfully, during the day the chickens can follow their suspicions and attempt to chase the foxes away. Will they be successful and get rid of their enemies, or are you just going to end up with a lot of fowl language?

Fox & Chicken is easy to learn, fun to play, and beautiful to look at. With rules included for play with up to twenty people (and potentially even more!) it's a mix of action and accusations, chaotic and clever in equal parts.
140693.name: Fox & Chicken
boardgameexpansion: Fox & Chicken Rooster Pack #1: Barn Wars
Fox & Chicken Rooster Pack #2: The Geek Pack

140694.description:
In Zooligans card game players take on the role of zookeepers trying to find animals to complete their exhibits. In so doing, they attract visitors to make the best zoo. The game is set up with a three exhibit goals, such as "4 or more reptiles" or "3 or more rainforest animals" that are central to all players. In addition, players have a secret continental theme, scoring them bonus visitors for animals from their continent.

When the game begins, players start with a hand of three animal cards. Each turn, players can bid on a worldwide animal in the auction. Then they play a card adding it to their zoo. When a player has all the animals to complete an exhibit goal, they can form the exhibit, attracting a number of visitors.

At the end of the game, the points are tallied, and the player with the most visitors wins.
140694.name: Zoodlums

140695.name: Bandits and Battlecruisers
140695.description:
From the back of the book:

BANDITS + BATTLECRUISERS = ADVENTURES IN SPACE

Bandits and Battlecruisers is an Old School Role Playing Game, based on Bandits & Basilisks mini-game and the classic Terminal Space supplement. On its 140 pages you will find:

Detailed character creation rules; Monster creation aids (plus 18 monsters - not the well-known monsters from the Original Game);
Complete rules for creating star sectors, star systems, planets, moons and space stations;
Five 100-keyword tables, helpful in designing monsters, robots, civilizations and planets;
100 random space encounters and 100 random space stations; Tools helpful in creating treasure hoards and artifacts (plus 16 sample artifacts);
Over thirty random tables;
Chapter with a detailed starship creation sequence and starship combat rules (plus over twenty sample spaceships).

140696.name: Spectromancer: Gathering of Power
140696.description:
User Summary

This expansion introduces 4 new classes: Warrior Priest, Vampire Lord, Cultist and Golem Master.

140697.name: escapeVektor
140697.description:
"Vektor is has been imprisoned inside the CPU and he needs your help to escape.

Take control of Vektor and escape the cunning CPU using the abilities Vektor will hack for you. There are 150* nodes (levels) and 27* zones (worlds) to escape from. In each level there are enemies and obstacles for you to overcome before you can escape as well as online leaderboards to compete on.

Vektor needs your help, please don’t fail him now...

Features (Nintendo 3DS and PlayStation Vita):

150 nodes (levels) spread over 27 zones (worlds)
Online leaderboards
4 Abilities to Unlock: Detonate, Boost, Super Boost and Boostenate
25 experience levels with upgrades for each ability
41 Badges (achievements to unlock)




Features (WiiWare):

30 nodes (levels) spread over 5 zones (worlds)
Abilities to Unlock: Detonate, Boost
40 Badges (achievements to unlock)"




Source: The Game Website.

140699.description:
Take me out to the ball game!

Nick's Finger Baseball is a free, two player game of strategy and outwitting. Playing the role of the captains of two baseball teams, both endeavor to lead their team to victory.

Over the course of 9 innings, there are a large number of turns. In each turn, each player simultaneously reveals their strategy for that part of the game. The player whose team is on offence reveals a number between 0 and 4, trying to reveal a high number... or are they? For they are also trying to avoid revealing one of the 2 numbers the defense revealed at that time, as revealing those spells disaster, which just gets worse the higher the number is! Do you shoot for high numbers and hope the defense isn't there, or try to sneak a lower number past them? As the defense, do you block the high numbers to stop power plays, or aim lower and stop sneaky plays?

Those are the types of choices you have to make in Nick's Finger Baseball, a battle of wits for 2 players!
140699.name: Nick's Finger Baseball

140700.description:
Welcome to the Port of Dutch Harbor, the gateway to King Crab fishing in Alaska. Every year, hundreds of crews gather in this small port to take advantage of the very short fishing season in their attempts to get rich overnight. But beware, the Bering Sea comes with great threats, challenging even the fittest. You will face freezing temperatures, waves the size of a ten stories block, heavy lifting, and drastic weather changes in a matter of hours.

In Perfect Storm: Alaska, 2-5 players take the role of small entrepreneurs looking to make their fortune fishing in the Bering Sea. You will start small, with a basic ship and a rookie crew led by a captain with big dreams but little experience. At first, your crew will venture into shallow waters after the easiest prey, the fish. With the money you earn, you will afford a better crew, maybe even a bigger boat and you'll be able to catch shrimp or even the most valuable King Crab – but you must hurry and use your resources wisely, the fishing season is short and the weather changes in no time.

Every turn, each player will command his crew, using his 3-5 actions to move to a new untouched area or to fish. Depending on the crew experience and the depth of the water, your crew will catch fish (the least valuable), shrimp or crab (the most valuable).

The weather cards dictate the wind speed, which will increase the waves. With a small boat you will have to face the storm in shallow waters, but with a bigger boat and an experienced crew you'll be able to defy the waves and venture into the eye of the storm to catch a larger quantity of King Crab. But beware, every time the wave size is greater that your ship's stability, you will roll the danger die and see whether you ship capsizes.

Perfect Storm: Alaska is a game of risk management and every player will have to calculate his decision to fish for the most valuable prey without exposing his crew and cargo to unnecessary danger. In the end, the winner will be the player who will find the best balance between his boat, crew and captain, the place to fish and the risk to face bad weather.
140700.name: Perfect Storm: Alaska

140702.description: Cat Hiding is a cute memory game in which each player starts with a hand of three cards; each card has three cat pictures, such as the face, tail or paws. A 4x4 grid of matching cards of each cat picture are placed face down. The active player plays a card from her hand, then flips three cards in the grid face up. If these cards match the card from her hand, she scores it. She may then attempt to match a second card from her hand, etc.
140702.name: Cat Hiding

140703.name: The Glass River Rescue
140703.description:
Publisher Blurb

A Pathfinder Society Scenario for characters of 1st to 5th level (Tier 1–5).
A Pathfinder leading a diplomatic envoy from the dwarven holds of the Five Kings Mountains has gone missing, and the balance of power in a time of war hangs on her rescue. The Pathfinder Society's divinations indicate the agent was waylaid in the theocratic nation of Razmiran, when one of her escorted diplomats failed to pay a requested tithe. Now it falls to the party to enter Razmiran, locate the missing Pathfinder and the dwarven diplomats, and escape with their lives.

140705.name: The Wardstone Patrol
140705.description:
Publisher Blurb

A Pathfinder Society Scenario for characters of 3rd to 7th level (Tier 3–7).
All-out war has erupted on the long-contested border between the crusader nation of Mendev and the demon-infested Worldwound. With the magical defenses that once held the demons at bay failing, defense of the region now falls to small patrols of mobile soldiers to resupply, reinforce, and communicate between the border's many fortresses and outposts. With so much at stake, the Pathfinder Society has enlisted many of its agents to assist in the war effort, both to protect its own interests and to prevent the onrushing tide of demonic attackers from plunging the entire Inner Sea region into chaos. On one such wardstone patrol, however, the party may find itself facing an enemy of an entirely different nature.

140706.name: The Hellknight's Feast
140706.description:
Publisher Blurb

Pathfinder Society Scenario for characters of 5th to 9th level (Tier 5–9).
War between demons and the civilized peoples of the Inner Sea region has broken out in the Worldwound far to the north of Absalom, but despite the regional implications of an Abyssal victory, many nations are ambivalent toward the cause. The Pathfinder Society, at the urging of Silver Crusade leader Ollysta Zadrian, arranges a formal banquet to be hosted by newlyweds Michellia and Damian Blakros, at which the society's agents can attempt to sway the political opinions of Absalom's movers and shakers. Will the Pathfinders succeed in securing the much-needed military support of Absalom and other nations bordering the Inner Sea, or will the crusaders and Pathfinders fighting on the front lines in Mendev find themselves standing alone before the demonic hordes?

140708.name: Siege of the Diamond City
140708.description:
Publisher Blurb

A Pathfinder Society Special for characters of 1st to 15th level.
After a recent discovery of a lost city in the heart of the demon-infested Worldwound, Pathfinder agents from around the world flock to Nerosyan, capital of the crusader nation of Mendev, to prepare for the coming adventure. When the city falls under attack, however, everyone within its walls must take up arms to defend against the Abyssal hordes. Do the Pathfinders have what it takes to hold back the demonic onslaught, or will their souls be among the first to be consumed when the Diamond of the North falls?
Designed to be run as an epic, multi-table event in which the actions of each table has the potential to turn the tide of battle, Siege of the Diamond City sets a new standard of interactivity for the fan-favorite convention special format. In addition to the adventure itself, the special includes a detailed gazetteer of the city of Nerosyan as well as a full-page map suitable for tracking the threat level throughout the city during the course of the event.

140709.description:
In Alhambra, players are acquiring buildings to be placed within their Alhambra complex.

On a player's turn, a player may take money from the open money market, purchase a building from the building market, or engage in construction and re-construction projects with buildings that have been placed in the player's reserve. The game rewards efficiency, as when a player purchases a building from the market for the exact amount of money, the player may take another turn.

Players with the most buildings in each of the six building types score in each of the scoring phases, and points are awarded for players' longest external "wall" section within their complex. The game ends when the building market can no longer be replenished from the building tile supply, and there is a final scoring, whereupon the player with the highest score wins.

This particular box, The Family Box, comes also with The Vizier's Favor expansion and a Pro version of Granada game.

The Vizier's Favor expansion adds 4 new modules to Alhambra:

1. The primary module is "The Vizier's Favor", which allows players to buy a building out of turn but has to be paid with exact amount.

2. "The Builders Huts" (Die Bauhütte) introduces a number of new tiles that only count in the scoring when other tiles of the same color are built next to them. Hut tiles are free, but their number is limited to three per player.

3. With the "The Currency Exchange" (Wechselstube), players can buy building tiles by mixing different currencies.

4. The fourth module is a set of bonus cards that are dealt to the players. Each of the tiles shows a particular building. If the matching building is part of your Alhambra, then the bonus card can be revealed and will count as another building of that category.

About Granada, also called as Alhambra Advanced: it is a standalone game the players develop the city of Granada next to Sierra Nevada, where the famous Alhambra stands, by buying building tiles to construct the city which will earn the most victory points. Building tiles now have two sides and there are new building types for which the value is set during the game.
140709.name: Alhambra: Family Box

140710.description:
Master Splinter has sent the Turtles out to get some Pizza for dinner. While traveling in the sewers, they are attacked by the evil Shredder and his minions!

Game Objective: Be the first player to get your Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtle back to Sewer Lair space first!

Game Play: Players spin the Turtle Spinner and move the indicated amount show along the board path. Bad Guys move at the beginning of each players turn. If a Bad Guy lands on a space with a player’s Ninja Turtle a battle will take place.

Starting the Game: Get ready for some serious Turtle Action as you fight your way to getting some Pizza! It’s Cowabunga Time Dude!!

Turn Summary: The player next to Turtle player spins the Bad Guys Spinner and moves the indicated Bad Guy shown on the spinner. Example: If spinner arrow lands on 1 or 3, then the Shredder pawn will be moved the number spaces towards the player’s Turtle pawns. If a Bad Guy lands on a space with a player’s Ninja Turtle a battle will take place.

Winning the Game: The first player to their Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtle back to Sewer Lair space wins!
140710.name: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Sewer Battle Game

140711.description:
In Carcassonne Big Box, players will find the basic game and nine expansions. This box is the gaming passport for Carcassonne fans old and new. The expansions can all be combined. Each of them is identified with a specific icon, making it easy to create the combinations you want to play, when you want to play them.
Carcassonne Big Box, a universe to discover!

Carcassonne is a tile-placement game in which the players draw and place a tile with a piece of southern French landscape on it. The tile might feature a city, a road, a cloister, grassland or some combination thereof, and it must be placed adjacent to tiles that have already been played, in such a way that cities are connected to cities, roads to roads, etcetera. Having placed a tile, the player can then decide to place one of his meeples on one of the areas on it: on the city as a knight, on the road as a robber, on a cloister as a monk, or on the grass as a farmer. When that area is complete, that meeple scores points for its owner.

2014-09-16: The goods token in Big Box 4 are larger than those released in the stand alone expansion Traders and Builders.
140711.name: Carcassonne Big Box 4

140712.description:
Gladiatori: The Wolf miniature allows animal variant in the Gladiatori game.

With animals it's possible to play alone, or players against animals, or players against players with animals against all.
Many other player variants are allowed.
140712.name: Gladiatori: The Wolf

140713.name: Rupert's "Four Winds" Game
boardgameversion: Express Books Rupert Fun Book Edition
140713.description:
Pre-school children's game from the Rupert Fun book.

Rules:
This game is played with a spinner (look at the foot of the page to see how it is made). Two, three or four players can take part, so choose which of the winds you’d like to be, set the spinner on the yellow centre of the blue circle and your game is ready.

Give each player a small counter, which should be placed on the circle marked 1 of the side he has chosen. The players then take turns to spin the arrow (it can be spun by the fingers or blown round). Before a player can start he must score number 6 on the blue circle. After that, any figure which he scores gives the number of circles he can move his counter. For example, if the arrow stops at 4, move the counter four circles, if it stops at 2, move two circles. The game goes on in this manner until one of the players reaches his circle marked 12 and is the winner.

140714.name: Repair the Mill
boardgameversion: Express Books Rupert Fun Book Edition
140714.description:
Pre-school children's game, from the Rupert Fun book.

Rules:
To play the game, make a spinning wheel with six sides, as shown in the diagram. Make a hole in the centre of the wheel and push a stump of pencil through it.

The two players are allowed to choose three squares each. One player might choose cement, nails and bricks, another might choose screws, glass and wood.

Take turns to spin the wheel, which is shaped in such a way that one of its names will lie on the table when it stops. If this name is one of the squares that the player has chosen, then he scores a point. Otherwise he does not score

First to reach a pre-agreed total number of points, wins.

140715.name: The Giant's Footprints Game
boardgameversion: Express Books Ruper Fun Book Edition
140715.description:
Game that appeared in the 1988 Rupert Fun book.

Rules:
This game is played on the footprints in the two ovals. First copy the two green footprints on thin card so that they can be cut out separately and used for counters. Next make a cardboard top, as shown on the right, and push a used matchstick through the centre to make it spin.

One player chooses the track marked L, and the other the track marked R, Each places his counter on the correct green footprint at the start. Take turns to spin the top. The number which rests on the table tells you how far you may move. Sooner or later one of you will land on the green footprint of your track. If the other player’s next turn takes his counter on to the other green footprint, he has made a “pair” and so wins the game.

140716.name: Borderlands 2 - Sir Hammerlock's Big Game Hunt
videogamecompilation: Borderlands 2: Game of the Year Edition
140716.description:
User Summary

Sir Hammerlock’s Big Game Hunt is the third story-based DLC for Borderlands 2. In it, the Vault hunters are tasked with locating a crashed Hyperion ship rumored to be filled with loot.

boardgamehonor: 2015 Spiel der Spiele Hit für Experten Recommended
140717.description:
Progress: Evolution of Technology is a card game about researching technologies. Each player takes his civilization from early antiquity and learns various technologies, moving progressively to the Middle Ages, the Industrial Revolution, and Modern Times and ending with today's Internet or Social Welfare.

Unlike other civilization games, Progress focuses on a single aspect of civilization building: researching technologies that help a society advance. The 210 technology cards in the game are divided into three ages (Ancient, Middle Ages, Industrial) and three types (Military, Science and Culture). With every advancement on a path, you gain easier access to its more advanced technologies and you'll end up opening the door to the next age.

Each tech card provides one bonus, which can vary from one extra knowledge to a larger hand size. Even though most tech cards in the game come in multiple copies (usually one per player), the key technologies occur less frequently, forcing players to specialize and granting them unique advantages. Every technology you research decreases the cost of up to three more advanced technologies, accelerating the race towards the end of the game.

The game play is streamlined, with players usually taking two actions, thus making each turn short and ensuring that you use the time when the others are playing for planning rather than seeing it as downtime.
140717.name: Progress: Evolution of Technology
boardgamepodcastepisode: Dukes of Dice - Ep 37 - Monkey Awards
Strange Assembly 157 - Your Name Here
The Long View: Age of Steam
Vox Republica 073: How Not To Be A Board Game Evangelist
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 22!!!
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 25!!!
Year end round up

140718.name: Mountain Bike Mayhem
140718.description:
user summary

"Who is this crazy old man, and what is he doing with a box full of other people's stuff? In this hair-raising adventure, the plot thickens with every choice the young reader is invited to make in this multiple-plot book designed to encourage positive values and trust in God."

140719.name: The Appalachian Ambush
140719.description:
user summary'

"On a hiking trip in the Appalacian Mountains the Ringers stumble across a sinister plot to rob Fort Knox! Will they try to stop the robbery? It's up to you! This series helps kids learn to make wise choices as they explore the many plot possibilities in each book.-plot book designed to encourage positive values and trust in God."

140721.name: Ultima I-VI Series
videogamecompilation: Ultima I: The First Age of Darkness
Ultima II: The Revenge of the Enchantress
Ultima IV: Quest of the Avatar
140721.description:
User Summary

The first six parts of the Ultima series on a CD-ROM

140722.name: Buccaneers!
140722.description:
Early eighteenth century, the Golden Age of Piracy! Legendary pirates sailing the seas of the Caribbean attacking merchant ships Europeans. Time to go to Tortuga, summon some sailors, and left for the seas of the Caribbean to loot some ships because we Buccaneers!

Buccaneers! is a board game for 2-4 players, developed by Julio Trois, about the Golden Age of Piracy in Caribbean Sea.

Each turn, players must navigate the seas of the Caribbean, attacking other pirates ships or warships Europeans (the battles are defined as the sum of the results of 3 dice), can also loot merchant ships (uses 5 dice. looted treasure depends on the combination of 5 dice, equal to Yatzee). But there is always the danger of sea monsters!

The game has the mechanics, Grid Movement, Dice Rolling, moreover, in each round, players can perform actions similar or different, increasing the strategic difficulties.

140723.name: Silence on tourne
140723.description:
You will play the role of a performer, a producer, a director or a film technician.

You move on a circular game board with a ± die, and must answer questions correctly to advance and earn points. These points are determined by your status report (as a performer, director, etc.) and ± the difficulty of the question (each card has a difficulty easy, medium or hard).

If a player can not answer, his opponents can take the question, Iif the player answers incorrectly he recieves 20 penalty points.

The first player to reach 250 points wins the game.

140724.description: In the Kickstarter campaign that greatly overfunded production of Guilds of Cadwallon, CMON Limited offered the option of paying $15 extra for a traditional gameboard that could accommodate up to a 5×5 game. Considering the cardgame size of the standard box, this implied a need for a large box to accommodate the board. The large box is sufficiently capacious to contain the board, the entire standard box, plus all Kickstarter extras, with room to spare. The only purpose for the box is to hold all the extra stuff. The board is completely superfluous, because the game was designed to be played on a table; however, for those that prefer fanciness….
140724.name: Guilds of Cadwallon: Gameboard & Large Box

140725.description:
As a mad scientist you're tired of the world laughing at your devious and diabolical attempts to rule the world. So you're calling in a little help in making your doomsday machines that much more "doomier". Scientists of various disciplines are willing to help you out with your machine, but be cautious. Some scientists will sabotage your machine, making harder to finish - and some scientists are a bit thumb-fingered. Too many mistakes and the world will end a bit early, whether anyone wants it to or not.

Players collect scientists of various disciplines: biologists, volcanologists, chemists, engineers, and occultists work together to activate different machine components. As players take turns either drawing or assigning scientists, the Doommakers - scientists the bring about the apocalypse early - make critical mistakes. Too may mistakes, and the game ends, possibly without any completed machines.

When the game ends, the player with the most points wins. Players earn points through activating components, point bonuses on components, and point modifiers found on your original machine.
140725.name: Doomworks

140726.name: Blaster Simulator
140726.description:
As a blaster you work your way up from small jobs to big ones. A level is considered to be solved, if the predetermined demolition rate has been reached and all set targets have been met. Every single action can be witnessed due to live cameras.

The most sensational blasts can even be stored. Once you have finished the career mode, all levels can be chosen individually so that you can go for the highscores at any time.

Source: The Publisher Website.

140727.description:
From the creator's webpage:

London Underground
In 1931 Harry Beck, a signal officer at London Transport, designed a map of the London Underground System, that today has become the standard for tube maps all over the world. However, the British transport authorities was skeptical about the map that Harry Beck made in his spare time. The passengers, on the other hand, were very satisfied, so soon the map became the official map of the London Transport. Harry Beck was paid around £5 for his effort!

My Tube map is a representation of the Tube map as of 2007 (notably with the Circle Line still a "circle" rather than the "spiral" it is today). I have used appropriate colors for the different tube lines, but I had to use yellow for both Circle Line and the DLR; white is used for both Hammersmith & City and the National Rail. Piccadilly and Victoria Line share the same blue color; District and Waterloo & City lines share green. I also had to invent some new stations, where the different lines cross.

The map can be printed on 8 A4-pages using either the PDF or the individual JPGs in the ZIP-file. The destination cards is designed to be printed on Avery C32011/C32016 (Business Cards) or on plain A4 paper. There is an optional backside included in the set.

Rules
In order to play using the map of the London Underground, you need the trains, the colored markers for each players and the train cards from the original game (either the USA- or the Europe-version). If you don't own the game, I encourage you to buy it. The Tubemap can be played by using the rules from the USA-version or the Europe-version. However since there isn't any ferries or tunnels on the map (despite the fact, that it is map of a underground-system!), you only need the stations from the European version.

The destination cards is divided into two categories: short routes < 17 and long routes > 17 points. In the European version of the game, each player is dealt three short routes and one long route at the beginning of the game and has to keep at least two routes. In the USA-version, the destination cards is mixed and you are given three to keep one.
140727.name: London Underground (fan expansion to Ticket to Ride)

140728.name: Whereabouts
140728.description:
Whereabouts is a trivial knowledge game based around the towns and cities of Great Britain. (Great Britain being the name of the island containing England, Wales and Scotland.)

Players take turn to roll a die, answer the appropriate numbered question and, if correct, move that number of spaces. A correctly answered 'six' allows you to take an additional turn immediately. The aim is to collect a token from the four corners of the map and return to the start.

Each card contains questions in six categories, all with multiple choice answers - Rivers; Cities; Motorways; Counties; General Knowledge; Correct Place Names.

1. Which river flows through a particular city? (3 options)
2. Which co-ordinate on the map is the location of a particular city? (2 options)
3. Which motorway connects two places? (3 options)
4. Which county contains a particular landmark? (3 options)
5. A general knowledge question associated with a particular place (3 options)
6. Which unlikely sounding name is a real place in Great Britain? (2 options)

140729.name: Say What You Meme
boardgamepodcastepisode: The Party Gamecast Reviews - Say What you Meme!
140729.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Say What You Meme is the #hilarious #new #party game in which you can create your own memes – pictures with hysterical sayings found on Facebook, Twitter, Reddit and other social media sites – and choose which are the funniest!

In the game, players get the chance to try their hand at this 21st century art form by combining hilarious images and witty text. It will be up to their opponents, though, to decide whose meme is the most clever!

140730.name: The Wall Game
140730.description:
A children's game for 2 or 4 players.

For the set-up, 52 plastic bricks in four colours are placed within a plastic frame. The colours are arranged in a pre-set configuration, as specified on the printed backing card. The frame is then stood up vertically, and the backing card is slid out.

Each player is assigned a colour, (or 2 colours in a 2 player game). Using the plastic mallets only, players then take it in turn to knock any brick out of the wall. Play generally progresses from the bottom of the wall up, so sudden collapses of multiple bricks frequently occur.

The first player to have none of their bricks remaining in the wall is the winner.

140731.name: NFL Challenge
140731.description:
NFL Challenge was a computer game, released in 1985 by XOR Software. It was notable for being one of the stronger football simulations of its time, with statistical models to not only the NFL season, but also the outcome of a single football game. Being one of the first football games for the PC it is still considered one of the best requiring 10 man-years to make and over 30,000 lines of code.

Source: Wikipedia, "NFL Challenge", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

140732.name: rain
videogamehonor: 2013 Game Critics Best Downloadable Game of the Year Nominee
2013 Game Critics Most Original Game of the Year Nominee
2014 D.I.C.E. Best Music Composition of the Year Nominee
140732.description:
User Summary

A boy awakens to see a girl's silhouette in the rain. He finds himself lost in a mysterious invisible world revealed only by the rain. Players control the boy as he attempted to save the girl from other invisible spirits that come alive in the rain, but the boy can only be seen when the rain falls on him. Players will need to interact with objects in the world to find their way.

140734.name: WarBreeds
140734.description:
WarBreeds is a Real Time Strategy computer game created by Red Orb and published by Brøderbund. WarBreeds was released in 1999. The game is set in a far off galaxy where the humanoid amphibian race called the Yedda have died out due to famine, disease and civil war, leaving their four former servitor races to fight for supremacy for their planet. WarBreeds features the ability to fully customise the warriors with many types of weapons which provide over 35,000 unique combinations. The central theme and mechanic of the game is genetic engineering.

Source: Wikipedia, "WarBreeds", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

140735.name: Faith of Morr
140735.description:
From the publisher's website:
“There are many spirits who wander the world. They have died but they cannot leave. Some are evil and cling to this place with malice. Some are merely unfortunate, and simply need to be shown the way.”
–Caspar Freundlich

Quiet the Empire's restless spirits and battle the corruption of necromancers with the new blessings and items in the Faith of Morr! This Print on Demand expansion for Warhammer Fantasy Roleplay introduces fifteen blessings and two items for your priest of Morr. These Doomsayers seem to follow their dreams at random, visiting places where people are about to die – whether from battle, plague, or natural disaster. They preach the doom they have foreseen, and they battle necromancers and the undead. Faith of Morr grants your characters new invocations to decide the fates of the dead, the undead, and the living.

Faith of Morr is a 20-card POD pack, consisting of:

Fifteen blessings spanning Rank 1 to Rank 5
Two item cards
Three information cards

140736.description: Gladiatori: The Lion is a new miniature for the Gladiatori board game. This miniature allows Animal variant in the game.
140736.name: Gladiatori: The Lion

140740.name: Nihilumbra
videogamehonor: 2013 AzPlay Awards Most Re-Playable Game Winner
2013 Indie Prize Best in Show Winner
140740.description:
User Summary

In Nihilumbra, the player controls Born, a sentient blob who escaped from The Void. The only problem is that once something goes missing from The Void, The Void tries to get it back. Help Born stay ahead of The Void by using colors to control his environment in this unique platformer game.

140741.name: Grudger
140741.description:
Grudger puts his life on the line for the morally ambiguous strangers he calls his customers. He’s a lowlife free runner in a dangerous steampunk world, and he always delivers the goods.

There is no life bar in this game; only the sound of crushed bones. Run, jump, roll, slide and bounce off walls to proceed. Use your environment to master all thirty levels with parkour.

Features:

- Swipe to act; never have to slip on a pseudo-button
- Not a side scroller, change your running direction anytime
- Complex level design with puzzle-like feel
- Collect aluminum bars to unlock survival mode
- 45 levels (more coming soon)
- Find hidden easter eggs
- Compete for high scores in survival mode

Source: The Developer Website.

140742.name: Cauldron-Born (4E)
140742.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the fifth adventure in the ZEITGEIST adventure path!

This is the D&D 4E version of this adventure.

A conspiracy has woven itself firmly into the dark underbelly of the city of Flint. The Royal Homeland Constabulary (RHC) has learned of its existence and knows it has a base beneath the haunted mountain named Cauldron Hill. Now at the king’s command it is time to rip this threat from its shadowy womb and thrust it into the light of day.

While they pursue that mission, two other forces are at work in Flint: a cult of dwarven assassins who want to disrupt a peace summit, and a rogue lord of the Unseen Court who seeks a war between man and fey. Either plot will spell disaster for Flint. Can the constables spare the time to stop them before the doom beneath Cauldron Hill is born?

A fantasy adventure for industrious heroes of levels 10-12.

boardgamehonor: 2013 Kinderspiel des Jahres Recommended
140743.description:
Madagascar Catan Junior introduces a modified playing style of the classic Settlers of Catan, giving young players a perfect introduction to the Catan series of games. The theme is from Dreamworks´ movie Madagascar 3.

Madagascar Catan Junior takes place on Madagascar island where 2 to 4 players build circus tents and wagons along the fields of the island. Using the appropriate side of the map either 2 or 3/4 players can join as the characters from the movie: Alex, Gloria, Marty or Melman.

Each field generates a specific resource from the game theme: Wood, bags of sand, popcorn, wool or nice juice cocktails. Each player starts with two circus tents on a specific spot on the island, and they can use the resources they acquire to build tents, wagons or get help from the Pinguins. By setting up more tents, they can expand their network; the more tents they build, the more resources they may receive. Just watch out for the controlling Zoo keeper!

Be the first player to set up all of your seven circus tents, and you win!
140743.name: Catan Junior Madagascar

140744.name: Dzeebagd: Under Dark and Misty Ground (d20)
140744.description:
From the back cover:

"Journey deeper into the treacherous goblin kingdoms in search of Evanna, daughter of the House Rothenheimer. But beware or the Maelstrom will drag you into the dark plots that surround her. Why was her father assassinated? What secrets does she hold? Perhaps the answers lie below, in the dungeon beneath the ruined tower of Dzeebagd.

Dzeebagd: Under Dark and Misty Ground, is a d20 System adventure for 4-8 characters of levels 2-4. Explore further the grim World of Inzae in this, Part II in the action-filled Death in the Trekland Trilogy."

140745.name: Felsentheim: Dogs of War (d20)
140745.description:
From the back cover:
"The action-filled, epic conclusion to the Death on the Treklant Trilogy! You have raised the ire of goblin warlord, and you now flee his kingdom with war parties hot on your trail. You must reach the borderland town of Felsentheim, for if you do not, no alarm will sound to harken the coming of the Dogs of War! Shall you claim the glory of heroes, or accept your doom?

Enter again the World of Inzae, where all things slip into the Maelstrom, and from hence true heroes are born. Felsentheim: Dogs of War, is a d20 System adventure for 4-6 characters of levels 3-5. It provides intense action, including a large-scale siege, and it requires heroes of high mind and daring spirit. Such heroes shall linger long in the halls of memory."

140746.name: Myths of the Far Future Campaign Guide (4E)
rpgseries: SANTIAGO: A Myth of the Far Future
140746.description:
From publisher blurb:

Myths of the Far Future is the overall title for EN Publishing's "sci-fi D&D" ruleset. It includes a default setting, but is also designed to allow you to create your own myths of the far future. Using the rules presented herein, you should find enough information to pay futuristic characters in any far future setting of your own making.

THIS IS THE D&D 4E VERSION OF THIS PRODUCT.
